data.title: Classics Du Jour
data.meta_description: Classics Du Jour is your home for everything classic rock! Featuring contests, news, videos, classic rock top ten lists, photos, tour dates and more, Classics Du Jour is a place to connect with other rock fans and your favorite classic rock artists.
data.text:
Two tour buses belonging to Styx and Foreigner went up in flames Wednesday afternoon in a parking lot in Philadelphia, TMZ has reported. The buses were unoccupied at the time and no injuries resulted. At this time, fire officials have no explanation for the cause. The fire was reported at 12:24 pm and was under … Continue reading Styx and Foreigner Tour Buses Go Up in Flames →

In a recent interview with WZBA/Baltimore, Don Felder talks about The Soundtrack of Summer – his tour with Foreigner and Styx, working with Sarah McLachlan, and his opinion on the Eagles documentary, History of the Eagles. Felder co-wrote the tune “Turn the Lights Down Low” which is featured on McLachlan’s most recent album, Shine On. … Continue reading Don Felder Talks Eagles, Sarah McLachlan and the Soundtrack of Summer Tour [LISTEN] →

The members of Styx have teamed up with fashion designer Diana Warner to support Rock the the Rescue (R2R) with a brand new jewelry collection. Rock To The Rescue is a 501(c) 3 nonprofit founded in 2002 by STYX and REO Speedwagon to help victims of the 9/11 tragedy. Playing a series of benefit concerts … Continue reading Styx Teams up with Fashion Designer for Rock To The Rescue Collection →

In a CDJ exclusive, Don Felder – former guitarist of The Eagles – discusses his new album, Road To Forever: Extended Edition with Jim Villanueva, as well as The Soundtrack of Summer Tour with Styx and Foreigner. Check it out below. Listen to Don Felder’s “You Don’t Have Me” here > Interview courtesy of Jim … Continue reading Exclusive: Don Felder Discusses New Album & The Soundtrack of Summer Tour →

A new version of the smash Eagles hit “Hotel California” has been re-recorded by songwriter and former Eagles member Don Felder along with members of Styx and Foreigner. YOU CAN LISTEN TO THE FULL SONG HERE > The song is featured on The Soundtrack of Summer – a collaborative effort between Styx and Foreigner featuring … Continue reading Welcome to the NEW ‘Hotel California’! [LISTEN] →

Styx and Foreigner have announced their “Soundtrack of Summer Tour” featuring special guest Don Felder. The three-month trek will launch May 16th in Oklahoma City and continue through the end of July. “The addition of Don Felder to ‘The Soundtrack of Summer’ tour means that the combined album sales of all 3 acts, as well … Continue reading Styx, Foreigner and Don Felder Announce Summer Tour →

Styx, REO Speedwagon and Ted Nugent are raising money for victims of the Boston Marathon bombing at each of the shows on their current tour. The artists are autographing and auctioning off a guitar at at every show on the Midwest Rock N Roll Express tour, with 75% of the auction proceeds going to Boston … Continue reading Styx, REO Speedwagon and Ted Nugent Raise Money for Boston Marathon Bombing Victims →

DON FELDER has joined forces with Styx singer/guitarist Tommy Shaw for the second single, “Wash Away” from FELDER’s second solo album (and first since 1983), ROAD TO FOREVER, released October 9, 2012 on Rocket Science Ventures. The song, which hit radio airwaves yesterday, was co-written by FELDER and Shaw, and features Shaw’s signature vocal sound. … Continue reading Don Felder Releases New Single Featuring Tommy Shaw →
